data.title: Very disappointed
data.text: From the website and reviews, we thought this was going to be a super cool place where we could taste some wine while having some great food. We were sadly disappointed. Our server almost seemed like we were bothering her by even being there. She brought us a food menu and a tablet with the wine menu. They had a few house specialties that were good prices and sounded like something we would like. However, when my husband tried to order, 2 out of the 3 he was interested in actually weren't available. He ordered the 3rd and when it came, it was in the tiniest glass we've ever seen - granted, dessert wines are often small pours, but this seemed even smaller than normal. We ordered empanadas and bacon wrapped shrimp skewers. The empanadas were pretty good, but I strongly suspect they were pre-made and only fried there. The shrimp were flavorless and rubbery, while the bacon around them was undercooked. We had already decided we were not going to order anything else, so when our server came, we told her we were ready for our check. She went to get the tablet and came back and showed us what she had charged us for. I went to my purse to get cash while she stood there awkwardly at the table -they already have the Square device plugged in at this point and clearly expect you to pay with credit. I handed her my cash and she looked a bit confused for a second, but then took it back to the bar area to get my change. She came back in just a few seconds and said they couldn't accept cash today because the owners didn't get cash from the bank (or something to that effect). My husband asked what they would do if we didn't have a credit card and she just smirked. The app led you to pre-selected tipping amounts (with your server standing over you the whole time), or you can choose a smaller button if you want to customize your tip amount. Our bill was not small and we walked out with a very bad taste in our mouth for this place. Won't be back next time we're in the area and hopefully we save someone else from this unpleasant experience.

data.title: Tapas in Temple
data.text: I enjoyed Tapas in Barcelona, Spain, but never expected to have Tapas that is as authentic as the ones I found at Vinoteca. Great wine collection, nice place, pleasant staff and great service. Extra clean and easy fine dining .

data.title: Great Tapas, Wine, Atmosphere
data.text: Downtown Temple is really coming alive and this is another great culinary offering.  The atmosphere is upscale casual, with different styles of seating options that cater to intimate, large groups or in-between.  They have an extensive wine selection as you'd expect, but also a great menu of varied and diverse tapas that are all delicious.  While it is a little pricey, it's consistent with what you'd expect to pay at this type of establishment.

data.title: Great tapas bar
data.text: Have been visiting this place with my wife for months now, most recently last week. Our favorites are the empanadas and sangria. Have tried several other tapas and desserts and everything has been superb. The servers are friendly and attentive. Parking is super easy in downtown Temple at all hours. The dining room has a classy atmosphere with a wall painting of Guernica.

data.title: Secret Getaway in Temple, TX
data.text: Vinoteca Urban Winery and Tapas Bar is one of Temple, Texas's best hidden secrets.  We visited on a Wednesday evening when the place was not overly crowded and received the best attention any customer could ask for.  We specifically wanted help in selecting a special wine that we could take on an upcoming cruise and Alex was, as always, a huge help. He has the ability to zero in on our specific likes and dislikes and makes ordering a wine flight a truly enjoyable experience!  Whether you are a wine "newby" or a seasoned wine lover, the staff of Vinoteca works hard to find that remarkable wine you will want over and over again. And the tapas!! What a nice collection of delicious bites that can be perfectly paired with the wines they offer.  Our waiter, Daniel had our orders out to us in a timely way and kept an eye on our needs as we went through the dining experience.  Whether you are there for dinner, the tapas, wine or any other combination, you will enjoy the time.  Shhhh, don't let the word out. This place is wonderful!!

data.title: A great tapas bar in Temple?!
data.text:
Tiramisu is on my mind. I have ordered tiramisu in almost every Italian flavored place that offers it and been uniformly disappointed or unimpressed. Vinoteca has my come back Tiramisu. I will go there again just for a slice of heaven (and it works for carry out).

Additionally, Vinoteca has very warm but trendy decor, perfectly prepared empanadas-beef, excellent seafood tapas, and very tasty and substantial flatbread concoctions. Dress up or come casual, be intimate or hooray it's Friday-all works here.  
I will see you with Tiramisu at my table.

data.title: Wonderful dinner!
data.text: My wife and I had dinner here on our way to Austin - the cheese board, empanadas carne, and paella all were excellent, as was the attentive and friendly service.  The wine selection was impressive, but we were very happy with glasses of the house wines, including the 10-yr tawny port with my dessert.  The atmosphere is warm and cozy, with a large mural that is a wine-themed homage to Picasso's Guernica - good date ambience.  Nice addition to the dining choices in Temple!

data.title: Wonderful and delish
data.text:
Family owned and they are always-always there. 
They are generous and fabulous. 
The food is delicious and always perfect. 
Wine and ports are 100%!

Go visit!

data.title: Love it!
data.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! I came here for lunch with a coworker and fell in love so I introduced it to my husband, now he refuses to eat anywhere else for lunch. After eating there for lunch MANY times I figured I should try out their dinner scene. I went with a friend who was visiting from out of town and we completely enjoyed ourselves. They had comfortable seating with a cozy atmosphere. The waitstaff was very attentive and the food of course AMAZING! We purchased a bottle of wine which was a little pricey but the food pricing was very reasonable. You should try it!

data.title: Another Great Option in Temple
data.text: Vinoteca is in an old building in downtown Temple.  (I believe it is where Molly's Deli was.)  The atmosphere is very conductive to sipping wine and trying their various offerings.  The night we were there the Empanada and Chicken Mingo were excellent.  The Beef Ribs were a little disappointing--a little too hard to get the meat off the bone and they were quite sweet.  The French Press coffee was outstanding.  The waitress was very knowledeable and the service was excellent.  We lingered over each course and had a great time talking with old friends.  This was our first visit and we plan to go back!

data.title: Vinoteca, Temple, Tx
data.text: My wife ordered an espresso, and it was terribly sour.  The server even agreed that there was something wrong and stated that the machine did not act right when she prepared the espresso (we got the impression that the espresso machine was a Keurig type machine and not a true espresso machine).  The next morning, my wife had the same terrible taste in her mouth and an upset stomach.  When I reported this to Vinoteca, instead of an apology, we received a response that essentially said they had never heard of this problem.  It almost seemed like Vinoteca was afraid of a reprisal from us when all we were doing was notifying them of the problem.

data.title: Good idea. Poor execution
data.text: Good atmosphere, but food is mediocre. Sangria was the worse I've tasted, poor selection of "tapas". I love the idea, but the execution is lacking in quality ingredients, selection, and originality. Hopefully they will get better as they develop the concept of tapas.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised by Vinoteca
data.text: The atmosphere is inviting. You'll notice the staff is creating a professional and friendly environment. This place has quickly earned its reputation as a mid-priced, family-owned restaurant with some class. Food is awesome! The owners were very nice and attentive. We are definitely coming back to eat. If you have never tried Tapas food before, Vinoteca is a great place to check out!

data.title: Love the concept
data.text:
Great atmosphere in Downtown Temple.  The concept of light fare paired with good wine is appreciated.  Generous menu selections offered variety.  We enjoyed an Old World Cheese plate with homemade bread-and-butter pickles. The cheeses were a nice selection and presented well.  The Empanadas, (owners Argentinian family recipe passed down over the years) were delicious.  Simple with complex flavors.  

Grand Opening is this weekend and staff is still learning but found them attentive with an obvious desire to succeed.  Overall, this was an enjoyable experience and hope they prosper.

data.title: Off to a slow start
data.text: Great atmosphere. They have not had their Grand Opening, so I cut them some slack for working the kinks out of the system. We almost finished a bottle of wine before our cheese trays and breads came out. In the end, it was delicious. They will have a very specific clientele. They only offer Wine and Water, no tea and sodas. It is very much a special occasion place for date night. At the moment, they only offer wine by the bottle. I think they are waiting on permits. We'll go back for a special occasion.
